title: Civil War Era Terms
description: Learn the distinctive vocabulary of the American Civil War period (1861-1865)

questions.question: During the Civil War, what was a 'secesh'?
What were 'hardtack and salt horse' in Civil War soldiers' language?

questions.question: In Civil War slang, what was a 'Copperhead'?
options: A Northern Democrat who opposed the war

questions.question: What did soldiers mean by 'seeing the elephant' during the Civil War?
options: Experiencing combat for the first time

questions.question: In Civil War vocabulary, what was a 'sutler'?
options: A civilian merchant who sold provisions to soldiers

questions.question: What was the Civil War term 'Butternut' used for?
options: A Confederate soldier, from their brown-dyed uniforms

questions.question: During the Civil War, what was 'grayback' slang for?
options: A body louse or a Confederate soldier

questions.question: What was a 'haversack' in Civil War terminology?
options: A soldier's canvas bag for carrying food and personal items

questions.question: In Civil War slang, what did 'played out' mean?
What was a 'picket' during the Civil War?
options: A soldier or group placed on guard duty ahead of the main force

questions.question: In the Civil War era, what was 'contraband'?
options: Enslaved people who escaped to Union lines

questions.question: What did 'skedaddle' mean in Civil War slang?
During the Civil War, what was a 'greenback'?
options: Paper currency issued by the Union government

questions.question: What was 'taps' in the context of the Civil War?
options: A bugle call signaling lights out or played at military funerals

questions.question: In Civil War terminology, what was a 'Zouave'?
options: A soldier in a unit wearing colorful French-inspired uniforms
